intro: Conyza coxii, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves with rough textures. The plant produces small, blue to purple composite flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Conyza coxii is characterized by its hairy stems and is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. It has a widespread distribution and is considered a weed in some agricultural areas.
